About Arcadia



                        Home                    /
About Arcadia

Home / About Arcadia




 


OUR MISSION


Arcadia University provides a distinctively global, integrative, and personal learning experience for intellectually curious undergraduate and graduate students in preparation for a life of scholarship, service, and professional contribution.









OUR VISION


Arcadia University’s pioneering, global, integrated, liberal arts and professional learning experience cultivates leaders who are intellectually fearless and uniquely prepared for life and work. Our highly regarded, values-based learning community reflects the world in which we want to live.












2,163
undergraduate students


1,447
graduate students


75
programs / fields of study






 



Arcadia’s Mission, Vision, and Values



Our Lived Values






Adaptability


We prepare community members with the nimbleness to address the multifaceted challenges of civic life and to pursue new strategies in a dynamic world. 









Excellence


We challenge ourselves to perform at and provide high standards in education, experience, and opportunity. Academic excellence is evidenced in the rigor and vigor of our programs and also in the qualities of our alumni. 









Fearlessness


We facilitate a boundless learning environment across disciplines that integrate diverse perspectives into new knowledge and novel solutions to complex problems. 









Integrity


We are honest and ethical in our actions, individually and collectively as an institution. Our integrative experiences, grounded in the liberal arts and sciences, cultivate intellectual and social responsibility. 









Intellectual Freedom


We encourage freedom of thought and expression irrespective of ideological perspectives throughout our community of learners. 









Justice


We bring our individual and collective resources to bear to seek positive transformation in our community and the world. We are always on guard against injustice and its causes. 









Respect


Embracing our diversity creates a rich and welcoming atmosphere where the difference in culture, perspective, and belief enriches academic discourse and campus life and creates a sense of belonging for all community members. 









Responsibility


We are committed stewards of Arcadia, and we will ensure that decisions are made in accordance with our institutional mission, goals, and guidelines. 












I chose Arcadia for a lot of reasons. But the biggest ones for me were the environment of the campus and the community when I visited. I wanted to go somewhere where I would be close to people. I didn’t want to go to a big campus. Arcadia isn’t giant. And it felt right when I visited. It clicked.


Michelle Teske ’26, Acting Major


























Arcadia is a Top-Ranked University









#1
in PA and #9 nationally for study abroad*


#1
in the nation for undergraduate study abroad participation**


11
years in a row on The Princeton Review’s Best Colleges






 





Arcadia University celebrates authenticity. Arcadia’s supportive community, quality academic programs, personalized education, and expert faculty help guide students toward career success and fulfillment.

The Princeton Review has ranked Arcadia among the “Best in the Northeast” for 11 consecutive years.
U.S. News & World Report ranks Arcadia as the #1 university in Pennsylvania for study abroad, and #9 in the nation (above Harvard, Yale, and Dartmouth universities).

*U.S. News & World Report**Institute of International Education’s Open Doors Report

Dining

Home / Life at Arcadia / Living and Commuting at Arcadia / Arcadia University Dining Services 



Dining

CateringMeal Plans 

More in: DiningCateringMeal Plans




The idea of living well is infused through the Metz Culinary Management experience. You’ll see it in our locally sourced ingredients, fresh and flavorful menus, emphasis on scratch prepared foods, and friendly and personal service.






 




                  Meal Plans                

We provide flexible meal plan options for resident and commuter students. 



                        LEARN MORE                      














Locations and Hours






Dining Hall 


The Dining Hall is an all-you-can-eat buffet for fresh and flavorful meals crafted from locally sourced ingredients, showcasing a dedication to scratch-prepared foods and personalized service. Options include fan favorites, as well as a salad bar, grille, and delicious eats catered to those with food allergies and restrictions. 
Monday-Thursday* 

Open from 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. (Light Lunch available from 2 p.m. to 4 p.m. daily, offering pizza, salad bar and continental breakfast options.)

Friday*

Open from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. (Light Lunch available from 2 p.m. to 4 p.m. daily, offering pizza, salad bar and continental breakfast options.)

*Except:

Monday, Sept 1 – Labor Day - weekend schedule
Thursday, Sept 11 – Rock the Knight - no dinner in the Dining Hall
Monday and Tuesday, Oct 13 and Oct 14 – Fall Break - weekend schedule
Wednesday - Sunday, November 26 - November 30 – Closed for Thanksgiving Break


Saturday, August 23


Meal Plans start at 4 p.m. for dinner in the Dining Hall.

Tuesday, December 16

Meals plan end after dinner.
 









The Chat


Location: The Commons, First Floor
The Chat in the Commons is a bustling hub of made-to-order delights for students on the move. Here you'll find staples like burgers, made-to-order sandwiches and salads, and hometown favorites (like fresh Wawa coffee!)
The chat reopens Sunday, August 24 at 2 p.m.
Monday-Friday*

Open from 7:30 a.m. to 10:30 p.m.

Saturday-Sunday*

Open from 2 p.m. to 10:30 p.m.

*Except:

Monday, Sept 1 – Labor Day - weekend schedule
Monday and Tuesday, Oct 13 and Oct 14 – Fall Break - weekend schedule
Sunday, Nov 30 – opens at 4 p.m. for dinner
Tuesday Dec 16 – Meal plans end after dinner; Chat closes at 8 p.m.
 









Easton Café


Location: Easton Hall, First Floor
Nestled in Easton Hall, Easton Cafe brews Starbucks coffee, lattes, and the like. Stop in for quick coffee breaks and snacks between classes, which you can enjoy next to the beautiful and relaxing Easton Pond.
Easton Café reopens Monday, August 25 at 8 a.m.
Monday-Thursday*

Open from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Friday*

Open from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m.

*Except:

Monday, Sept 1 – Labor Day - weekend schedule
Monday and Tuesday, Oct 13 and Oct 14 – Fall Break - weekend schedule
Wednesday - Sunday, Nov 26 - Nov 30 – Closed for Thanksgiving Break
Tuesday Dec 16 – Meal plans end after dinner
 









Global Café


Location: Oak Summit Apartments, B Building Entrance Lobby
Students in Oak Summit Apartments enjoy our Global Cafe, which offers a delightful array of coffee, snacks, breakfast sandwiches, flatbread pizzas, hot sandwiches, quesadillas plus Grab & go sandwiches and salads.
Global Cafe opens Monday, August 25 at 9 a.m.
Monday-Friday

Open from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.
 







Menus and More

We are proud to offer global, authentic flavors, as well as gluten-free, vegetarian, and vegan options.






 

 Dining Menus















 

 Specials















 

 Monthly Events















 

 Easton Cafe

 Catering Form





















Day Breakers includes cooked-to-order eggs, an omelet bar, pancakes, waffles, delicious breakfast proteins, and breakfast sandwiches.
Green Scene, our tasty salad bar, includes fresh and flavorful fruits and vegetables. Try our house-made, scratch dressings!
DuJour, our soups of the day, are made fresh daily. The menu changes with the seasons, and we use local ingredients whenever possible. 
Main Plate offers a wide selection of classic favorites, trendy gourmet selections, and specialty sandwiches.
Villa Toscana, our made-to-order Italian specialties, including hand prepared strombolis, pizzas, and pasta.
J. Clark’s Grille features house-made specialty burgers, hot sandwiches fresh from the grill, wings, fries, and more. 
Market Street Deli is a made-to-order deli station that offers a wide variety of fresh toppings, meats, cheeses, and breads.
Bravo! allows our chefs to showcase their talents as they quickly prepare each dish—with colorful arrays of fresh ingredients—on the spot.
Gluten-Free Zone offers options for students with gluten sensitivity.
Vegetarian & Vegan provides an impressive range of plant-based options that students flock to.

More in: Information TechnologyEmployee IT  InformationStudent IT InformationScheduled System MaintenanceInformation Technology & Campus Service Level Agreements








Information Technology


Information Technology (IT) serves the needs of the entire Arcadia University community, both domestic and abroad. We strive to build a collaborative Technology Community of Practice, sharing information and building a single, integrated enterprise architecture to enable faculty, staff, and students. 




Employee IT InformationStudent IT Information


Information Technology Support Services
Information Technology Support Services (ITSS) is the forward facing arm of the IT Department. We manage the Help Desk, AV Event Support, Classroom/Academic Technology, and Hardware Management. Please make sure if you have a question or need help, submit a ticket.


Digital Learning Services
Digital Learning Services (DLS) provides assistance, information and technology-related learning strategies to faculty who wish to integrate technology into their courses, and to staff who wish to incorporate technology in the work they do for Arcadia. Our specialties include Instructional Design and Instructional Technology. Sign up for a personalized consultation. 






Infrastructure and Security
Infrastructure and Security manages and maintains the campus infrastructure from wired to wireless and everything in between. Manages the security of everything connected to the network and provides analysis of risks associated with computer applications.


Enterprise Applications
The Enterprise Applications support team provides software implementation, development, and maintenance support for the University’s enterprise systems, in addition to developing and supporting in-house developed applications systems and reports.








 




                  Help Desk                

The IT Help Desk is open for drop-ins and scheduled appointments (made at least a day in advance). Submit a Help Desk ticket for software installation, network-related connection issues, basic tutorials and how-tos, and equipment troubleshooting (prior to scheduling an appointment).
